Text Content: The daily gridded map of Absolute Dynamic Topography data is obtained fromAVISO/DUACS ftp site (ftp://ftp.aviso.oceanobs.com)

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: The daily gridded ocean surface vector wind data from ASCAT is obtained fromftp://ftp.ifremer.fr/ifremer/cersat/products/gridded/MWF/L3/ASCAT/Daily

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: The daily gridded SST data of Reynolds OISST is obtained fromftp://eclipse.ncdc.noaa.gov/pub/OI-daily-v2/NetCDF

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: This dataset may be cited as "MOSDAC (http://www.mosdac.gov.in)",(Sikhakolli et al., 2013). Sikhakolli, R., R. Sharma, R. Kumar, B. S. Gohil, A. Sarkar, K. V. S. R. Prasad and S. Basu, Improved determination of Indian Ocean surface currents using satellite data, Rem. Sens. Lett., 4, 335-343, 2013.

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: Using the daily gridded data of MADT, Vector winds and SST data the Geostrophic, wind driven and buoyancy components of the ocean surface current respectively are first calculated for the off-equatorial regions (3°N to 90°N and 3°S to 90°S).

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: Using the polynomial expansion the equatorial currents (±3° latitude band) are derived.

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: The daily ocean surface current at 0.25° resolution is then derived by applying a linear weighted average procedure to the equatorial and off equatorial current solutions with in the latitude band of ± 3° to ± 4° band.

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: Bentamy A..; D. Croize-Fillon, 2011: Gridded surface wind fields from Metop/ASCAT measurements. Inter. Journal of Remote Sensing. DOI 10.1080/01431161.2011.600348.

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: Bonjean, F, and G. S. E. Lagerloef (2002), Diagnostic model and analysis of the surface currents in the tropical Pacific Ocean., J. Phys. Oceanogr., 32, 2938-2954.

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: Reynolds, R. W., T. M. Smith,_C. Liu, D. B. Chelton, K. S. Casey, and M. G. Schlax (2007), Daily high-resolution-blended analyses for sea surface temperature, J. Climate., 20, 5473-5496.

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: SSALTO/DUACS user hand book: (M)SLA and (M)ADT Near Real Time and Delayed Time products, AVISO, Nov 2009.

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: The methodology follows the work of Bonjean and Lagerloef (2002). The basic equations are those of quasi linear and steady flow in a surface layer where the horizontal velocity U = (u,v) is allowed to vary with vertical coordinatez, and where vertical turbulent mixing is characterized by an eddy viscosityAuniform with depth. The vertical shear Uzreaches zero at a constant scaling depthz= -H. Using complex notationsU(x,y,z,t) = u + iv and ∇ = ∂/∂x + i ∂/∂y, the basic equations areifU = - (1/ρm) ∇ p + AUz(1a)(1/ρm) pz= -g + ∇θ(1b)∇θ = g χT∇SST ,(1c)

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: with - H ≤ z ≤ 0, and subject to the following boundary conditionsUz(z=0) = τ / A(2a)Uz(z = -H) = 0(2b)

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: The characteristic density is ρm= 1025 kg m-3,

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: The acceleration due to gravity g = 9.8 m s-2,

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: and the coefficient of thermal expansion χT = 3 x 10-4K-1,

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: The vector field τ = τx+ i τyrepresents the surface wind stress divided by ρm,

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: H has been chosen to be 70 m,

Text Content: The parameter A is chosen by the empirical formulation as A = a (|W|/W1)b| w| 1 m s-1where W1= 1 m s-1, a = 8 x 10-5m2s-1, and b = 2.2

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: where W1= 1 m s-1, a = 8 x 10-5m2s-1, and b = 2.2 .

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: The equation for the velocity shear is

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: which is a second-order differential equation in velocity shear Uz , subject to the boundary conditions (2a,b). After solving for the shear profiles, one can find an expression for the velocity at the surface, which is

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: Here the function q is defined by q (x) = x /tanh (x) and he= (A/if )1/2is complex and its modulus is proportional to the Ekman depth he= sqrt( 2A/|f|).

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: Using equation (4) and the datasets mentioned above, the daily ocean surface currents were generated. Equatorial velocities (±3° latitude band) are obtained by solving a weak formulation of the momentum equations using a basis set of orthogonal polynomials as described in Bonjean and Lagerloef (2002).

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: As the equatorial currents are estimated through an approximation procedure using polynomial coefficients the correlation with in-situ currents in the equatorial region is observed to be relatively poorer especially for the meridional currents.

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: As these input satellite data are not very reliable near to the coast, the estimated currents very near to the coast may also have problems.

Page Title: Global Ocean Surface Current | Meteorological & Oceanographic Satellite Data Archival Centre
Text Content: OSCAR Currents: Bonjean, F, and G. S. E. Lagerloef (2002), Diagnostic model and analysis of the surface currents in the tropical Pacific Ocean., J. Phys. Oceanogr., 32, 2938-2954

Text Content: GEKCO Currents: Joel Sudre, Christophe Maes and Veronique Garcon (2013), On the global estimates of geostrophic and Ekman surface currents. Limnology and Oceanography. DOI: 10.1215/21573689-2071927
